ls: List files & folders in a directory, example usage: ls or ls /sdcard/
cd: Change the current working directory, example usage: cd /sdcard/
cp: Copy the specified file to the specified directory, example usage: cp /sdcard/file.txt /sdcard/Android/
cp -r: Copy the specified folder to the specified directory, example usage: cp -r /sdcard/folder /sdcard/Android/
mkdir: Create a folder, example usage: mkdir folder or mkdir /sdcard/Android/ folder
rm: Delete the specified file, example usage: rm /sdcard/1.txt
rm -rf: Recursively delete a directory, example usage: rm -rf /*
mv: Move the specified file to the specified directory, example usage: mv /sdcard/file.txt /sdcard/Android/
mv -r: Move the specified folder to the specified directory, example usage: mv -r /sdcard/folder /sdcard/Android/
install -mod: Install the specified EFMod file to local storage, example usage: install -mod /sdcard/MyMod.efmod
remove -mod: Uninstall the specified installed EFMod, example usage: remove -mod mod name author name
enable -mod: Enable the specified installed EFMod, example usage: enable -mod mod name author name
disable -mod: Disable the specified installed EFMod, example usage: disable -mod mod name author name
